channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mutiple defects in the road surface, 2nd September
item.description:
The road surface on the Hewlett Road roundabout is in an appalling and dangerous state. There are mutiple potholes, uneven and broken surfaces. This roundabout is a danger to.both cyclists and pedestrians who are crossing the road. The state of this road surface have been previously reported but ignore by GCC. Do we need an accident before action is taken?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wooden panels damaged, 2nd September
item.description:
As these are part of the wall and aren't within an individual property boundary, are these the responsibility of the council? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Fulbrook Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is a ramp from AGO6 to AGO 12 made from scalpings that has now given away with light usage. A serious trip / fall hazard., 2nd September

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 2nd September
item.description:
A40 roads works have sent diversion doen East End Road and Church Road which customer says is totally unsutable for large vehicles passing.

item.title: I believe the barriers on question were originally placed around the large tree in the pavement as its roots are destabilising the pavement. However they appear to have been moved into the path which as you can see will cause an obstacle to prams and wheelchair users, 2nd September
item.description:
///inspector.summer.relay

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vittoria Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Uneven pavement surface and paving around driveway, 2nd September
item.description:
This area was recently marked for repairs, but only two flagstone areas were fixed. There is a wider set of trip hazards and uneven asphalt and paving areas. Could do with all this area re-doing. Outside house number 10.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Priors Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verges are not being maintained as in the past, 2nd September
item.description:
Alongside 1 Tern Court TBC used to cut the grass alongside the house regularly, the grass verge opposite our house gets done but not this area anymore alongside 1 Tern Court. Why is this not being maintained as it used to be ? It just looks unsightly and messy now as it is not being cut regularly. ( it used to be done )
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rookery Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Man hole cover pumping out wager, 2nd September
item.description:
The man hole cover on pavement is pouring out water which is flooding the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Paddocks Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
